name: dfs.blockreport.initialDelay
description:
Delay for first block report in seconds. Support multiple time unit
    suffix(case insensitive), as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval.If
    no time unit is specified then seconds is assumed

name: yarn.app.mapreduce.shuffle.log.limit.kb
description:
Maximum size of the syslog.shuffle file in kilobytes
    (0 for no limit).

name: mapreduce.job.speculative.retry-after-speculate
description:
The waiting time(ms) to do next round of speculation
  if there are tasks speculated in this round.

name: yarn.app.mapreduce.shuffle.log.backups
description:
If yarn.app.mapreduce.shuffle.log.limit.kb and
    yarn.app.mapreduce.shuffle.log.backups are greater than zero
    then a ContainerRollngLogAppender is used instead of ContainerLogAppender
    for syslog.shuffle. See
    org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender.maxBackupIndex

name: dfs.webhdfs.netty.low.watermark
description: Low watermark configuration to Netty for Datanode WebHdfs.

name: dfs.datanode.lock-reporting-threshold-ms
description:
When thread waits to obtain a lock, or a thread holds a lock for
    more than the threshold, a log message will be written. Note that
    dfs.lock.suppress.warning.interval ensures a single log message is
    emitted per interval for waiting threads and a single message for holding
    threads to avoid excessive logging.

name: mapreduce.job.speculative.retry-after-no-speculate
description:
The waiting time(ms) to do next round of speculation
  if there is no task speculated in this round.

name: mapreduce.jobhistory.loadedjobs.cache.size
description:
Size of the loaded job cache.  This property is ignored if
  the property mapreduce.jobhistory.loadedtasks.cache.size is set to a
  positive value.

name: dfs.datanode.transfer.socket.recv.buffer.size
description:
Socket receive buffer size for DataXceiver (receiving packets from client
    during block writing). This may affect TCP connection throughput.
    If it is set to zero or negative value, no buffer size will be set
    explicitly, thus enable tcp auto-tuning on some system.
    The default value is 0.
